steps.data: {"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":24,"offset":31,"style":"italic"},{"length":10,"offset":79,"style":"italic"}],"key":"ad7mr","text":"Determine the cell density of aCafeteria roenbergensis culture: stain 10 \u00b5L of Cafeteria culture with 1 \u00b5L of Lugol\u2019s acid iodine solution and count them on a haemocytometer (Neubauer Chamber)","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"514bi","text":" ","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"a3m30","text":" ","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"40bs1","text":" ","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"6ff8h","text":" ","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":[]}

{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":9,"offset":11,"style":"italic"},{"length":1,"offset":38,"style":"sup"}],"key":"iqc2","text":"Dilute the Cafeteria culture to 5 x 105 cells\/mL in f\/2 medium + 0.03% yeast extract and let them grow O\/N at 20-25\u00b0C ","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":[]}

{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"2ld54","text":"Under-layer the cell suspensions approx. 4 ml of 10% solution of OptiPrep using a syringe and a flat needle.","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"length":1,"offset":0}],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"1n967","text":" ","type":"atomic"}],"entityMap":[{"data":"{\"blocks\":[{\"key\":\"94hn\",\"text\":\"The OptiPrep stock should be diluted in 1X Gradient Buffer\",\"type\":\"unstyled\",\"depth\":0,\"inlineStyleRanges\":[],\"entityRanges\":[],\"data\":[]}],\"entityMap\":[]}","mutability":"MUTABLE","type":"notes"}]}

{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"f3coa","text":"Load approx. 4 ml of 20% solution of Optiprep\u00a0 underneath the 10% solution using a syringe and a flat needle.","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"9uumv","text":" ","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"length":1,"offset":0}],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"8be9c","text":" ","type":"atomic"}],"entityMap":[{"data":"{\"blocks\":[{\"key\":\"56mup\",\"text\":\"The OptiPrep stock should be diluted in 1X Gradient Buffer\",\"type\":\"unstyled\",\"depth\":0,\"inlineStyleRanges\":[],\"entityRanges\":[],\"data\":[]}],\"entityMap\":[]}","mutability":"MUTABLE","type":"notes"}]}

{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":17,"offset":78,"style":"bold"}],"key":"5i9hj","text":"Centrifuge the tubes using an ultra-centrifuge at\u00a0 20000 rpm, 20\u00b0C for 20 min with slow braking.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":[]}

{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"3gl1c","text":"Recover Cafeteria cells from the gradient, at the interphase between the 10% and 20% Optiprep layers. You can collect them by pipetting from the top or use a syringe and needle.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":[]}

{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":16,"offset":0,"style":"italic"}],"key":"60pqm","text":"C. roenbergensis can be left in f\/2 medium (no added yeast extract) overnight without affecting flagellate viability\n","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"length":1,"offset":0}],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"cvk6k","text":" ","type":"atomic"}],"entityMap":[{"data":"{\"blocks\":[{\"key\":\"m1qn\",\"text\":\"Account for about 30% of cell loss from the initial stock (from step 4)\",\"type\":\"unstyled\",\"depth\":0,\"inlineStyleRanges\":[],\"entityRanges\":[],\"data\":[]}],\"entityMap\":[]}","mutability":"MUTABLE","type":"notes"}]}

{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"fgonp","text":"In SW40 Ultra-Clear centrifuge tubes, load not more than 5 ml of the cells suspension in 1X Gradient Buffer. ","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":[]}

{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"3n3bq","text":"It is recommended to remove the OptiPrep from the flagellates by centrifuging them at 4,500 g, 5 min, room temperature.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":[]}

source.description: {"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":24,"offset":165,"style":"italic"}],"key":"1ovn6","text":"Heterotrophic flagellates require co-culture with bacteria that serve as a food source. This protocol explains how to reduce the bacterial background of cultures of Cafeteria roenbergensis.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":[]}
Centrifuge the Cafeteria cells at 4,500 g, 5 min, room temperature

Wash twice the cell pellet with 1X PBS
=> use small volume of PBS to concentrate the cells

Prepare the different reagents (CaCl2 and 2X HEBS) according to the followed protocol from
Pia Elustondo

steps.data: {"blocks":[{"key":"etrbd","text":"-O marina cultures in F\/2 medium supplemented with heat inactivated bacteria. The cultures were maintained with the heat inactivated bacteria supplanted every week with an extra addition an hour prior to the transfection.\u00a0 (It has not been tested yet if this addition one hour before the transfection is critical or not).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":1,"length":17,"style":"UNDERLINE"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"ah0h4","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"fo3pq","text":"-ULYISIS Nucleic acid labeling kit (Molecular Probes, Cat # U21650). This kit is used to prepare the DNA and label it with a fluorophore. In our case, we used the ULYSIS Alexa 488 labeling kit.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":1,"length":33,"style":"UNDERLINE"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"1ate2","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"2bh0f","text":"-Transfection reagents","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":1,"length":21,"style":"UNDERLINE"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"5u56r","text":"2.5 M CaCl2","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"a8lmq","text":"2XHEBS (274 mM NaCl, 10 mM KCl, 1.4 mM Na2HPO4, 15 mM D-glucose, 42 mM HEPES (free acid), pH 7.10","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":41,"length":1,"style":"sub"},{"offset":45,"length":1,"style":"sub"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"8rcs1","text":"HBS0\/2: 144 mM NaCl, 3 mM KCl, 2 mM MgCl2, 10 mM HEPES pH 6.7 (alternatively other protocols use PBS pH 7.4). It was also possible to see the transfection with no washes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":40,"length":1,"style":"sub"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"2voc9","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}

{"blocks":[{"key":"845q9","text":"Use only fragments that are 100 bp to 1000 bp","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"db6e0","text":"Long DNA can be degraged with DNAse into fragments 100 to 1000 bp. The ULYSIS kit includes DNAse and a protocol to produce fragments in that range. Alternative PCR products can be used. The labelling kit suggests not to use longer fragments to avoid precipitation of the labelled fragments.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"a1cmu","text":"For labeling 1 ug of DNA, cleaned PCR products or DNA fragments should be precipitated in 3M sodium acetate (pH5.2) and two volumes of absolute ethanol, freeze at -70 \u00b0C for 30 min and then for 15 min at 12,000 g. Wash the pellet with 70 % ethanol and allow it to air dry. Resuspend the pellet in 20 ul of the labeling buffer from the ULYSIS kit. Alternatively I have eluted the PCR products from the mini column in 30 ul of the labelling buffer form the ULYISIS kit.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"4stjd","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}

{"blocks":[{"key":"47ok8","text":"The following two steps were performed exactly as indicated in the instruction manual of the kit. It was up scaled to label 5 ug of DNA","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"4o5l2","text":"Denature the DNA at 95 \u00b0C\u00a0for 5 min and then snap cool on ice. Centrifuge the tube briefly to redeposit the sample to the bottom of the tube","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"bm6ld","text":"Add 1 ul of Alexa fluo Ulysis reagent per ug of DNA","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"1t171","text":"Incubate at 80 \u00b0C for 15 min. Stop the reaction by placing the tube on ice. Centrifuge briefly","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}

{"blocks":[{"key":"b5fpu","text":"Purify the product from the excess of free ULS labelling reagent using a gel filtration-based spin column. The instructions recommend Bio-Rad Micro Bio-Spin \u00aeP-30 or Princeton Separations Centri-Sep. I used Zeba spin desalting columns (Zeba, Thermo Scientific, cat # 89882)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}
steps.section: 3. Purify the labelled DNA fr the free ULS labelling reagent

steps.data: {"blocks":[{"key":"bl1bf","text":"-Prepare DNA\/CaCl2 mix for transfection of 1 ml of dense culture:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":17,"length":1,"style":"sub"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"5gm6t","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"cfle8","text":"DNA \u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 1-8 ug","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"bp7tf","text":"2.5 M CaCl2\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 5 ul","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":10,"length":27,"style":"sub"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"5uqgl","text":"Nuclease free H2O\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 to 50 ul final volume","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":15,"length":1,"style":"sub"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"3vfdp","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"1djie","text":"If there is a desire to increase the amounts of DNA to 3-24 \u00a0ug , the CaCl2 should be increased to 15 ul and the final volume to 150 ml.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":74,"length":2,"style":"sub"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"6s4a5","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"1ikql","text":"-Mix the DNA\/CaCl2 with equal volumes of HeBS. IMPORTANT: add 1\/10th of the volumes of the DNA\/CaCl2 mix at a time mixing well by vortexing 3 s after each addition. This gradual mixing avoids local over concentrations of CaCl2, which creates an unevenly sized precipitate. Supposedly, only very fine precipitate is efficiently taken up by the cells.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":17,"length":1,"style":"sub"},{"offset":99,"length":1,"style":"sub"},{"offset":225,"length":1,"style":"sub"},{"offset":47,"length":11,"style":"bold"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"5gbhs","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"6lclt","text":"-Incubate 20 min at RT","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"eagih","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"806v0","text":"-Add 800-1000 ul of O marina culture","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"698mi","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"dp190","text":"-Incubate at RT. Image at different time points. I saw the fluorescence after about 4-5 and collected images 24 h later.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"d0jad","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"f2feb","text":"-The efficiency seems to be 30-40 % but a lot of them show fluorescence in the nucleus, suggesting that this could be potentially an appropriate method to generate stable transfected O marina.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"8goob","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"f156o","text":"-There is a wash step in which the cells are supposed to be rinsed with HBS0\/2 three times and then resuspended in their medium but I noticed a lot of cell damage with centrifugation so I skipped the washes and did a dilution in F\/2 medium in half the first day.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"8njhn","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"dp5i4","text":"This protocol was adapted from \u00a0Matz J, Gilyan A, Kolar A, McCarvill T, Krueger SR. Rapid structural alterations of the active zone lead to sustained changes in neurotransmitter release. Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences of the United States of America. 2010;107(19):8836-8841. doi:10.1073\/pnas.0906087107.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":187,"length":79,"style":"italic"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"95l8r","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"d3v21","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"8faoi","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}

source.body: Aliquot and autoclave the 2X HEBS buffer to avoid contamination

source.description:
Mix the CaCl2 (final concentration 125 mM) with the material to electroporate
- for DNA electroporation complete to the final volume with water
- for protein electroporation complete to the final volume with 1X PBS or the buffer the most suitable for the protein
For one electroporation, final volume of the CaCl2 mixture
10-μl tips: 3.5 μl
100-μl tips: 48.5 μl

Add the CaCl2 mixture onto the 2X HEBS
For one electroporation, 2X HEBS volume
10-μl tips:  5 μl
100-μl tips: 50 μl
Option 1: volumes are big enough to vortex constantly the HEBS while the CaCl2 mixture is added drop by drop
Option2: 1/10th of the CaCl2 mixture is added at a time with a 3-secondes vortexing-step between each addition

Count the cells: stain 10 µL of Cafeteria culture with 1 µL of Lugol’s acid iodine solution and load them in a haemocytometer (Neubauer Chamber)
Maximum volume of the desirable number of cells needed for the electroporation = 1.5 μl
Add the 1.5 μl volume of the appropriate number of C. roenbergensis cells to the CaCl2/HEBS mixture
Electroporate the cells at 1600V, for 20 ms, 1 pulse using either the 10-μl or 100-μl tips
Place the electroporated cells into 10 time more f/2 media than the electroporated volume for 30 min
Cells can either be fixed or maintained in culture by adding 5 time fresh f/2 media complement with 0.02% yeast extract and 1/500th of E.coli culture

protocol.title: Protist Research to Optimize Tools in Genetics (PROT-G)

steps.data: {"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":1,"offset":14,"style":"sup"},{"length":9,"offset":16,"style":"italic"}],"key":"dhad2","text":"Aliquot 5 x 106 Cafeteria cells per 1.5 ml microfuge tube for each microscopy sample","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":[]}
{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"ek02d","text":"Centrifuge for 5 min at 5,000 g, 20\u00baC","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":[]}

{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"4if01","text":"Resuspend each pellet in 500 \u00b5L of 4% paraformaldehyde (PFA) in 1X PBS","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":[]}
{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"djm1e","text":"Incubate for 20 min at 20\u00baC","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":[]}
{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"uidc","text":"Resuspend the pellets in 500 \u00b5L of 0.5% Triton in 1X PBS","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":[]}
{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"41at1","text":"Incubate for 15 min at 20\u00baC","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":[]}

{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"bo11j","text":"Clean the filter-support grids of a vacuum manifold system with pure water (e.g. ELGA, milliQ)","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":[]}
{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"fd1an","text":"Apply vaccum to remove the drop of water","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":[]}

{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"etm42","text":"Add a drop of ELGA water on each grid of the vacuum system that you want to use and place a 0.45 \u00b5m Millipore support filter on top of it","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":[]}
{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"50oun","text":"Add another drop of ELGA water on top of the Millipore filter","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":[]}

{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"5p3hl","text":"Place a 0.2 \u00b5m, 25 mm Anodisc Whatman filter on top of the ELGA water drop","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":[]}
{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"e8rji","text":"Apply vacuum with a pressure between 5-10 Hg to remove the water","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":[]}

{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"922j6","text":"If neccesary, block or wash the filter with the required solution.","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"dt887","text":"Remove the solution by applying vacuum","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":[]}

{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":9,"offset":10,"style":"italic"}],"key":"65p9q","text":"Place the Cafeteria sample from step 8 on top of the Whatman filter","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":[]}

{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"4tksn","text":"Apply vacuum with a pressure between 5-10 Hg to remove the permeabilization buffer and to immobilize the cells on the filter","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"length":1,"offset":0}],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"bbq4o","text":" ","type":"atomic"}],"entityMap":[{"data":"{\"blocks\":[{\"key\":\"8cn73\",\"text\":\"Perform all the neccesary blocking and washing steps following the same instructions\",\"type\":\"unstyled\",\"depth\":0,\"inlineStyleRanges\":[],\"entityRanges\":[],\"data\":[]}],\"entityMap\":[]}","mutability":"MUTABLE","type":"notes"}]}

{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":9,"offset":26,"style":"italic"}],"key":"8gqsr","text":"Place the filter with the Cafeteria sample on a piece of Parafilm. Add the staining solution of interest on top of the filter and incubate following the manufacturer's instructions","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":[]}
{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"5gaoe","text":"Place the filter on the vacuum system again","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":[]}

{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"fl941","text":"Apply vacuum with a pressure between 5-10 Hg to remove the remaining staining buffer","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":[]}
{"blocks":[{"key":"141t1","text":"If required, wash the filter again with the buffer of interest","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}

{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"dc512","text":"If desired, stain DNA by incubating with an appropriate reagent (DAPI, SYBR, Hoechst)","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":[]}

{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"7t7e0","text":"Apply vacuum with a pressure between 5-10 Hg to remove the remaining liquid","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":[]}

{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"8l2ur","text":"Add 10\u00a0\u00b5L of 70% glycerol on a glass slide and place the filter on top of the glycerol","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"length":1,"offset":0}],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"624ef","text":" ","type":"atomic"}],"entityMap":[{"data":"{\"blocks\":[{\"key\":\"cl9e9\",\"text\":\"The filter must be placed with the Cafeteria cells in the top!\",\"type\":\"unstyled\",\"depth\":0,\"inlineStyleRanges\":[],\"entityRanges\":[],\"data\":[]}],\"entityMap\":[]}","mutability":"MUTABLE","type":"safety"}]}

{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"behlu","text":"Add 10 \u00b5L of 70% glycerol on the coverslip and place it on top of the filter","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":[]}
{"blocks":[{"key":"8ura","text":"Apply pressure on the sample during 20 min at room temperature","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}

{"blocks":[{"key":"j06e","text":"Seal the coverslip with nail polish","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"6vckv","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":0}],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[{"type":"notes","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":"{\"blocks\":[{\"key\":\"4dq8g\",\"text\":\"Samples can be kept at 4 \\u00b0C or analyzed with the microscope immediatly\",\"type\":\"unstyled\",\"depth\":0,\"inlineStyleRanges\":[],\"entityRanges\":[],\"data\":[]}],\"entityMap\":[]}"}]}

source.description: {"blocks":[{"key":"2rbet","text":"Fluorescence microscopy is essential to understand,\u00a0between others, the cell organization and the life cycle of viruses that infect them.
